title: Low frame rates from MultisenseSL cameras in VRC Task1

content.raw:
In VRC Task 1, the rostopics responsible for publishing images from the MultisenseSL cameras are publishing at a frequency of roughly 15 Hz on average. This is only the case in Task 1; the same topics publish at rates of about 25-30 Hz in Tasks 2 and 3.

These rates are measured in simulation time. VRC Task 1 runs at a real-time factor of about 0.5, so I am only receiving roughly 8 images per second on average. I have attached some data, which is by no means exhaustive, but characterizes the problem I am seeing. The data presented are the rates reported by "rostopic hz" after running for 2 minutes simulation time.
content.html:
In VRC Task 1, the rostopics responsible for publishing images from the MultisenseSL cameras are publishing at a frequency of roughly 15 Hz on average. This is only the case in Task 1; the same topics publish at rates of about 25-30 Hz in Tasks 2 and 3.

These rates are measured in simulation time. VRC Task 1 runs at a real-time factor of about 0.5, so I am only receiving roughly 8 images per second on average. I have attached some data, which is by no means exhaustive, but characterizes the problem I am seeing. The data presented are the rates reported by "rostopic hz" after running for 2 minutes simulation time.
